Rise and Early Life

Original Name: Farid Khan
Title: 'Sher Khan' (given by Bahar Khan Lohani, ruler of Bihar, after killing a tiger).
Son of Hasan Khan, a jagirdar of Sasaram (Bihar). He gained power in Bihar and Bengal through his administrative abilities. Defeated Humayun in the battles of Chausa (1539) and Kannauj (1540) and founded the 'Suri dynasty'.

ЁЯТ░
Administrative Reforms

Sher Shah is known for his administration, which was later adopted by Akbar.
Currency: Introduced the modern 'Rupiya' (silver coin, 178 grains) and 'Dama' (copper coin).
Land Revenue: Streamlined the 'Zabt' system and provided 'Patta' (title deed) and 'Qabuliat' (acceptance deed) to the peasants. Used 'Gaz-e-Sikandari' for land measurement.

ЁЯЫгя╕П
Roads and Communication

He rebuilt the Sark-e-Azam (Grand Trunk Road / GT Road), which ran from Sonargaon (Bengal) to Peshawar (Pakistan). Built Sarai (inn) which were called the 'arteries of the empire'.

ЁЯП░
Architecture and Death

Architecture: Built the Purana Qila in Delhi and the 'Qila-e-Kuhna' mosque within it. His own mausoleum is located in the middle of an artificial lake in Sasaram (Bihar), which is an excellent example of Indo-Islamic architecture.
Death: Died in 1545 while conquering the fort of Kalinjar (Bundelkhand) due to the bursting of a firearm/cannon called 'Ukkah'.
